spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The knight is a 7th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (save {@dc 17}, +9 to hit with spell attacks). The knight may choose from the following spells:
footerEntries: When casting any spell roll a {@dice d20}. On a roll of 1 a Wild Magic Surge effect occurs.

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: Il cavaliere ha un vantaggio sulle prove di Saggezza ({@skill Perception}) che si basano su vista, udito o olfatto.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The knight regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Betcher's Gland
entries: The knight may use its bonus action to spit acid at a target within 10 feet, make a ranged attack using its Constitution modifier. If the attack hits it deals 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage and 5 ({@damage 2d4}) acid damage and the target must make a {@dc 18} constitution save or be {@condition {@condition blinded}} until the end of their next turn. The knight-captain regains the use of this trait when it finishes a short or long rest.

trait.name: Black Carapace
entries: Il cavaliere ottiene un bonus di +2 alla sua CA (incluso sopra).

trait.name: Weaponry
entries: Il cavaliere è armato con un'arma da mischia e un'arma a distanza dall'elenco delle opzioni nella sezione azioni. Può anche essere armato di uno scudo che aumenta la sua CA a 22.

trait.name: Force Weapon
entries: The knight may use its bonus action to imbue its melee weapon with magical power, using a spell slot of 1st level or higher and dealing {@damage 2d6} psychic damage per spell slot level on the next attack with that weapon that hits. The magical power in the weapon fades after 1 minute if not used.

trait.name: Heritage of the Crimson King
entries: The knight knows 3 cantrips and only practices non-cantrip spells from one school of magic: Abjuration, Conjuration, Divination, Enchantment, Evocation, Illusion, Necromancy, or Transmutation and gains a bonus depending on their chosen school:
Abjuration: When the knight casts an abjuration spell they gain 18 ({@dice 4d8}) temporary hit points.
Conjuration: Whilst concentrating on a conjuration spell, the knight's concentration can't be broken as a result of taking damage.

Divination: The knight may use their bonus action to divine the future of one enemy creature they can see; the knight gains advantage on the next attack roll against that creature or the creature has disadvantage on the next saving throw the knight forces them to make.

Enchantment: When a creature within 30 feet of the knight makes an attack roll against it, the knight may use its reaction to divert the attack to another target in the attack's range. The attacker must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom save or target the creature closest to it not including the knight or itself.

Evocation: When the knight casts an evocation spell that affects creatures other than itself it can choose a number of creatures equal to 1 + the spell's level. The chosen creatures automatically succeed their saving throws and take no damage if they would normally take half on a successful save.

Illusion: When a creature makes an attack roll against the knight, it can use its reaction to interpose an illusory duplicate between the attacker and itself. Roll a {@dice d20}, on 11 or higher the attack misses the knight, then the illusion dissipates.
Necromancy: Once per turn when the knight kills a creature that's not a construct or undead with a spell of 1st level or higher it regains hit points equal to 3 times the spell's level.
Transmutation: The knight can cast alter self without expending a spell slot.

Il cavaliere riacquista l'uso di questo tratto al termine di un riposo breve o lungo.

trait.name: Bone Breaker
entries: When the knight scores a critical hit with a melee attack it may attempt to cripple its foe. The creature that was hit must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated}, have their movement reduced to 5 ft. and be knocked {@condition prone}. This effect remains until they healed by a spell such as greater restoration.

trait.name: Heritage of the Lupercal
entries: Once per turn the knight gains a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls against a creature that is within 5 ft. of one of the knight's allies that isn't {@condition incapacitated}. Additionally the knight can make an unarmed strike as a bonus action.

trait.name: Heritage of the Hydra
entries: After finishing a short rest the knight may choose two bonuses from the following list, that last until the end of the next completed short rest:

items: The knight may dash as a bonus action.
The knight may disengage as a bonus action.
The knight may use its reaction to make a melee attack against a creature that enters its reach.
The knight may use its bonus action to gain advantage on a melee attack roll that turn.
The knight may use its bonus action to gain advantage on a ranged attack roll that turn.
The knight has advantage on initiative rolls.
The knight gains proficiency in a saving throw it doesn't currently have proficiency in.
Moving through non-magical terrain doesn't cost the knight extra feet of movement.

entries: Additionally the knight has proficiency with improvised weapons.

resist.note: from non magical weapons

trait.name: Guardian Spear
entries: Melee attacks made with this weapon are considered adamantine for the purposes of resistance and immunity.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the knight-guardian fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Lightning Blows
entries: On a critical hit with a melee attack, the knight-guardian can make a single additional attack against the same creature. This attack cannot generate an additional attack on a critical hit.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The knight-guardian has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The knight-guardian regains 13 hit points at the start of their turn if they have at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Multiattack Defence
entries: When a creature hits the knight-guardian with an attack, the knight-guardian gains a +4 bonus to their AC against all subsequent attacks made by that creature for the rest of the turn.

trait.name: Relentless Endurance
entries: When the knight-guardian is reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, they can drop to 1 hit point instead. The knight can't use this feature again until they finish a long rest.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight-guardian makes three melee attacks with its guardian spear, or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Guardian Spear (Slash)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Guardian Spear (Thrust)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 5d4 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Guardian Spear (Ranged)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 13} to hit, range 100 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) lightning damage. A bolt of lightning forming a line of 100 feet long (or the lesser distance between the knight and the target) and 5 feet wide blasts out from the guardian spear. On a hit each creature in the line that isn't the target must make a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes the weapon's damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Whirlwind
entries: The knight-guardian makes a Guardian Spear (Slash) attack at each creature of its choice within 10 feet, making the attack with disadvantage if the creature is more than 5 feet away.

reaction.name: Riposte
entries: When a creature misses the knight-guardian with a melee attack, the knight-guardian can make a melee weapon attack against the creature.

resist.note: from non magical weapons

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the knight-sentinel fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The knight-sentinel has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The knight-sentinel regains 13 hit points at the start of their turn if they have at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Relentless Endurance
entries: When the knight-sentinel is reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, they can drop to 1 hit point instead. The knight can't use this feature again until they finish a long rest.

trait.name: Bulwark
entries: The knight-sentinel gains a +1 bonus to its AC if it has moved 0 ft. on its turn.

trait.name: Praesidium Shield
entries: Whilst wielding this shield, if the knight-sentinel is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it can use its reaction to take no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, interposing the shield between itself and the source of the effect. Additionally if the knight-sentinel moves no more than half its movement speed on its turn, it counts as being in half cover against ranged attacks whilst wielding this shield.

trait.name: Sentinel Blade
entries: Melee attacks made with this weapon are considered adamantine for the purposes of resistance and immunity.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight-sentinel makes three melee attacks with its sentinel blade, or four ranged attacks.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d4 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Sentinel Blade (Ranged)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 13} to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d4 + 6}) force damage. If the attack is a critical hit it deals an additional 4 ({@damage 1d8}) force damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The knight-sentinel adds 7 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the knight-sentinel must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

item.name: Adamantine Talon
entries: One of a pair of unique gauntlets incorporating 3 blades, each the length of a man's entire arm and deadly sharp. Similar in design to other {@item lightning claw|FFESLL} weapons but with the ability to retract the blades to more easily handle other weapons such as pistols. These form the staple of {@creature the Raven|FFESLL}'s personal panoply of weapons.

entries.name: Special
entries: You may roll the damage dice twice for this weapon and choose the higher result. This weapon is considered adamantine for the purposes of resistance and immunity.

item.name: Dawnbringer
entries: A monstrously large-headed warhammer of very skilled craftsmanship, wielded in one hand by {@creature the Drake|FFESLL} during battle and able to shatter his foes with tremendous force.

entries.name: Special
entries: If hit and affected by the damage, the target must make a Constitution saving throw, with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier, or be {@condition stunned} until the end of their next turn. If the target has 50 hit points or fewer and failed the saving throw it is reduced to 0 hit points.

item.name: Fireblade
entries: A nearly perfectly wrought sword that glows with an impressive internal heat, granting it its moniker and allowing it to slice through foes with sublime ease. Originally crafted by {@creature the Gorgon|FFESLL} and given to {@creature the Phoenician|FFESLL} as a gift.

entries.name: Special
entries: You may roll the damage dice for this weapon twice, choosing the higher result of the two.
Additionally if the weapon scores a critical hit the critical damage is {@damage 4d4} instead of 2d6.

item.name: Forgebreaker
entries: An exquisitely fashioned warhammer of considerable size, said to be able to level a mountain in a single blow. Originally crafted by {@creature the Phoenician|FFESLL} and given to {@creature the Gorgon|FFESLL} as a gift.

entries.name: Special
entries: If hit and affected by the damage, the target's movement speed is reduced by 5 ft. until the end of their next turn and they must make a Constitution saving throw, with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier, or be {@condition stunned} until the end of their next turn.

item.name: Forgiveness
entries: One of a pair of gauntlets alongside {@item Mercy|FFESLL} that are wielded by {@creature the Night|FFESLL}, it features two long and wicked blades each perfectly designed to tear apart flesh and armour alike leaving naught but ravaged and flayed corpses in its wake.

entries.name: Special
entries: You may roll the damage dice twice for this weapon and choose the higher result. On a critical hit this weapon deals an additional {@damage 2d4} slashing damage.

item.name: Frostaxe
entries: A large run-inscribed axe that emanates a chilling aura, razor sharp and leaving heinous, frostbitten wounds on those that feel its bite.

entries.name: Special
entries: This weapon deals an additional {@damage 2d4} cold damage on a hit.

item.name: Frostblade
entries: A large run-inscribed sword that emanates a chilling aura, razor sharp and leaving heinous, frostbitten wounds on those that feel its bite.

entries.name: Special
entries: This weapon deals an additional {@damage 2d4} cold damage on a hit.

item.name: Frostaxe Helwinter
entries: A mighty double-bladed frost axe carried in one hand by {@creature the Wolf King|FFESLL}; an exemplar amongst weapons of its kind, many of the Wolf King's foes have fallen to its icy blades with little resistance.

entries.name: Special
entries: This weapon deals an additional {@damage 4d4} cold damage on a hit.

item.name: Frostblade Mjalnar - Sword of Balenight
entries: Also known as the Fang of {@creature the Wolf King|FFESLL}, a great blade of terror and blood against which no armour can stand as the sword's sliver-white blade inexplicably darkens as it kills, first to the deep red of heart's blood and then to a fathomless, glittering black.

entries.name: Special
entries: This weapon deals an additional {@damage 2d4} cold damage on a hit. If hit and affected by the damage, the target must make a Constitution saving throw, with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier, or take {@damage 4d4} necrotic damage.

item.name: Gladius Incandor
entries: A sizeable gladius, easily the length of a longsword and capable of cleaving armour apart like paper; often found at {@creature the Regent|FFESLL}'s side.

entries.name: Special
entries: You may roll the damage dice twice for this weapon and choose the higher result. If the weapon scores a critical hit the critical damage is {@damage 3d6} instead of {@damage 2d6}.

item.name: Gorechild
entries: The smaller of a pair of massive {@item Ripper Axe|FFESLL}s carried by {@creature the Slaughterer|FFESLL}; this huge axe's haft is made from near unbreakable metal and its teeth and the razor-sharp fangs of dead ancient dragons.

entries.name: Special
entries: If the weapon scores a critical hit the critical damage is {@damage 4d4} instead of {@damage 2d6}.

item.name: Gorefather
entries: The larger of a pair of massive {@item Ripper Axe|FFESLL}s carried by {@creature the Slaughterer|FFESLL}; this huge axe's haft is made from near unbreakable metal and its teeth and the razor-sharp fangs of dead ancient dragons.

entries.name: Special
entries: If the weapon scores a critical hit the critical damage is {@damage 3d6} instead of {@damage 3d4}.

item.name: Guardian Spear
entries: A slightly misleading name for the formidable weapon wielded by a {@creature Knight-Guardian of the Lightning Lord|FFESLL}, this polearm resembles a glaive with a strange arcane device capable of projecting blasts of lightning mounted next to the blade.

entries.name: Special
entries: This weapon is considered adamantine for the purposes of resistance and immunity.

entries.name: Ranged Attack
entries: This weapon may also make ranged attacks in the same manner as a ranged weapon, which deal 4d8 lightning damage.

When fired, a bolt of lightning forming a line 100 feet long (or the lesser distance between the firer and the target) and 5 feet wide blasts out from the Guardian Spear. On a hit each creature in the line that isn't the target must make a Dexterity saving throw, with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier. A creature takes the weapon's damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
When used as a ranged weapon it has the following additional properties:

item.name: Hand of Dominion
entries: Designed for {@creature the Regent|FFESLL}'s left hand, this powerful weapon strikes blow that pulverise his enemies beneath his wrathful onslaught.

entries.name: Special
entries: If hit and affected by the damage, they must make a Constitution saving throw, with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier, or be {@condition stunned} until the end of their next turn.

item.name: Heavy Gauntlet
entries: A large reinforced gauntlet, designed to channel and enhance every mote of the user's strength.

entries.name: Special
entries: If hit and affected by the damage, they must make a Constitution saving throw, with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier, or be {@condition stunned} until the end of their next turn.

entries.name: Special
entries: This weapon deals an additional {@damage 1d4} piercing damage on a hit or an additional {@damage 1d6} piercing damage if used with both hands.

item.name: Illuminarum
entries: A giant {@item heavy morningstar|FFESLL} carried by {@creature the Herald of the Word|FFESLL}, beautifully crafted and able to concuss opponents as well as deal deadly wounds.

entries.name: Special
entries: This weapon deals an additional {@damage 2d4} piercing damage on a hit. If hit and affected by the damage, they must make a Constitution saving throw, with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier, or be {@condition stunned} until the end of their next turn.

item.name: Lightning Claw
entries: A gauntlet with three blades that are attached to the back of the hand and extend past the knuckles like long, sharp claws; each crackles with the thrum of the lightning unleashed when they slash apart opponents.

entries.name: Special
entries: This weapon deals an additional {@damage 2d4} lightning damage on a hit. You may roll the damage dice twice for this weapon and choose the higher result.

item.name: Lightning Whip
entries: A long and deadly whip that coruscates with imbued lightning, one of the panoply of weapons carried by {@creature the Raven|FFESLL}.

entries.name: Special
entries: This weapon deals an additional {@damage 1d6} lightning damage on a hit. On a hit the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier, or be {@condition blinded} until the end of their next turn.

item.name: The Lion Sword
entries: A powerful broad-bladed sword that glows with a soft inner light and scorches those struck with a silver flame. Its keen edge makes a mockery of even the finest armour or the mightiest foes, cutting a clear path for {@creature the Lion|FFESLL} through the darkest of battlefields.

entries.name: Special
entries: You may roll the damage dice twice for this weapon and choose the higher result. If the weapon scores a critical hit the critical damage is {@damage 3d8} instead of {@damage 2d8}.

item.name: Lupercal's Talon
entries: A large and masterfully wrought gauntlet carried by {@creature the Lupercal|FFESLL}; each finger a long and ferociously keen blade, as well as a bespoke twin-linked bolt thrower on the dorsal side, it forms a deadly weapon that loses none of the normal dexterity a gauntlet would have.

entries.name: Special
entries: You may roll the damage dice twice and choose the higher result when using this weapon in melee.

entries.name: Ranged Attack
entries: This weapon may also make ranged attacks in the same manner as a ranged weapon, which deal {@damage 2d4} piercing damage.
When making a ranged attack roll with this weapon roll two d20 and choose the higher result. If the attack is a critical hit it deals an additional {@damage 1d8} piercing damage.
When used as a ranged weapon it has the following additional properties:

item.name: Mercy
entries: One of a pair of gauntlets alongside {@item Forgiveness|FFESLL} that are wielded by {@creature the Night|FFESLL}, it features two long and wicked blades each perfectly designed to tear apart flesh and armour alike leaving naught but ravaged and flayed corpses in its wake.

entries.name: Special
entries: You may roll the damage dice twice for this weapon and choose the higher result. On a critical hit this weapon deals an additional {@damage 2d4} slashing damage.

item.name: Moonsilver Blade
entries: A sword presented to {@creature the Angel|FFESLL} by {@creature the Praetorian|FFESLL} and forged from the same unyielding alloy as the latter's fortress, this blade is carried by {@creature the Angel|FFESLL} as a contingency when he wields {@item the Spear of Telesto|FFESLL}; the sword itself has proven over time to be highly effective against fiends and its polished edge can blind foes as it shines like moonlight.

entries.name: Special
entries: On a hit the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier, or be {@condition blinded} until the end of their next turn. Additionally if a target hit by this weapon is a fiend they take an additional {@damage 2d6} piercing damage.

item.name: Reaper Scythe
entries: Fashioned after the great {@item Silence|FFESLL} wielded by {@creature the Reaper|FFESLL}, this scythe's cutting edge drips with a deadly poison.

entries.name: Special
entries: This weapon deals an additional {@damage 1d6} poison damage on a hit.

item.name: Sentinel Blade
entries: A large, finely crafted broadsword wielded by a {@creature Knight-Sentinel of the Lightning Lord|FFESLL}. It has a pair of powerful bolt throwers built onto either side of the hilt, allowing the wielder to cut down foes both up close and at range.

entries.name: Special
entries: This weapon is considered adamantine for the purposes of resistance and immunity.

entries.name: Ranged Attack
entries: This weapon may also make ranged attacks in the same manner as a ranged weapon, which deal {@damage 2d4} force damage. It's ammunition is
If a ranged attack with this weapon is a critical hit it deals an additional 1d8 force damage.
When used as a ranged weapon it has the following additional properties:

item.name: Silence
entries: A monstrously large scythe wielded by {@creature the Reaper|FFESLL} in battle, slicing through foes as easily as a normal scythe would cut through wheat and coated in a poison so deadly it stops the hearts of the frail instantly.

entries.name: Special
entries: If the target has 50 hit points or fewer they must make a Constitution saving throw, with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier, or be reduced to 0 hit points.

item.name: Spear of The Wolf King
entries: Originally called the Dionysian Spear when it was forged by the Lightning Lord himself and sometimes referred to as Gungir, it was gifted to {@creature the Wolf King|FFESLL}; however he was made uneasy by the spear's presence and rarely took it with him into battle. He would often "lose" it on battlefields or "forget" it in his chambers and he carried it only to please the Lightning Lord. Despite his attempts to part with the weapon, it would always ultimately return to his side.

The weapon itself has craftsmanship only matched by its sister weapon, the Apollonian Spear, it contains a portion of the Lightning Lord's own power and it has has the ability to "illuminate" those it pierces, revealing to them some aspect of truth.

entries.name: Special
entries: If the target has 50 hit points or fewer they must make a Constitution saving throw, with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier, or be reduced to 0 hit points. Additionally this weapon is considered adamantine and a creature pierced by this weapon has some aspect of truth revealed to them.

item.name: Storm's Teeth
entries: A colossal two-handed {@item Ripper Sword|FFESLL} believed to be too weighty for any but the {@creature the Praetorian|FFESLL} or his brothers to wield, able to shred the strongest armour or fortifications with its razor-sharp teeth.

entries.name: Special
entries: You may roll the damage dice twice for this weapon and choose the higher result.

item.name: The Blade Encarmine
entries: An ornate greatsword of fine craft carried into battle by {@creature the Angel|FFESLL}, the blade is a deep crimson in hue which grants the weapon its moniker.

entries.name: Special
entries: On a critical hit this weapon deals an additional {@damage 1d8} slashing damage.

item.name: The Blade of Ahn-Nunurta
entries: A {@item khopesh glaive|FFESLL} of considerable size to match the giant stature of {@creature the Crimson King|FFESLL}, its serrated blade resonates with arcane power and allows those with a mastery of magic to channel their energies to empower the weapon.

entries.name: Special
entries: If the wielder is a spellcaster they can use their bonus action to imbue this weapon with magical power, using a spell slot of 1st level or higher and dealing {@damage 2d8} psychic damage per spell slot level on the next attack with this weapon that hits. The magical power in the weapon fades after 1 minute if not used.

item.name: The Blade of the Laer
entries: A beautifully crafted, single-edged sword etched with a strange symbol that hurts the eyes to look upon; this sword was discovered by {@creature the Phoenician|FFESLL} at the centre of a floating coral island that was once home to the now extinct Laer.

entries.name: Special
entries: If any of the damage dice roll maximum damage you may roll one additional damage die.

item.name: The Pale Spear
entries: A strange and esoteric weapon associated with {@creature the Hydra|FFESLL}, the double-bladed spear seemingly flickers out of phase with the material plane and emits an eerie and otherworldly howl when wielded. It is capable of piercing and ripping apart any physical defence it encounters; while against living matter it inflicts hideously bloodless gaping wounds on its targets, as the flesh where it strikes dissolves into oily smoke.

entries.name: Special
entries: Attacks made with the Pale Spear treat immunity as resistance. If hit, the target must succeed a Constitution saving throw, with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier, or take an additional {@damage 2d12} necrotic damage. If the target has 50 hit points or fewer and failed the saving throw it is reduced to 0 hit points.

item.name: The Spear of Telesto
entries: Wielded by {@creature the Angel|FFESLL} into battle alongside the {@item Moonsilver Blade|FFESLL}; this long spear has a blade shaped like an elongated tear with a hollow in the centre to represent a single drop of blood, and its shaft is sculpted to depict a hooded sanguine angel.

entries.name: Special
entries: On a critical hit, instead of rolling extra damage dice, the weapon's damage is doubled.

item.name: Thunder Hammer
entries: A large warhammer that's closer to a maul and hums with the energy it contains, letting out powerful blasts of thunder when struck against a target.

entries.name: Special
entries: On a hit, this weapon deals an additional {@damage 2d4} thunder damage.

item.name: Masterwork Thunder Hammer
entries: A large warhammer that's closer to a maul and hums with the energy it contains, letting out powerful blasts of thunder when struck against a target.

entries.name: Special
entries: On a hit, this weapon deals an additional {@damage 2d4} thunder damage.

item.name: White Tiger Dao
entries: {@creature The Khan|FFESLL}'s primary weapon on the battlefield, this weapon is a beautifully crafted sword with a distinctive curve akin to both a scimitar and a tulwar but with comparable length to a greatsword. Finely balanced, skilled users can strike with a surprising swiftness both mounted and on foot.

entries.name: Special
entries: The first attack made on a turn with this weapon adds +2 to its damage roll.

item.name: The Wolf Blade
entries: A blade of ancient provenance borne by {@creature the Lion|FFESLL}; a masterpiece of the armourer's craft, whose silver teeth wrought a fearsome ruin upon his foes and shattered the resolve of those that stood against him.

entries.name: Special
entries: You may roll the damage dice twice for this weapon and choose the higher result.

item.name: Worldbreaker
entries: Forged by the Lightning Lord himself and given to {@creature the Lupercal|FFESLL} as a gift, this weapon is a massive masterfully crafted mace capable of breaking the strongest armour and crushing the toughest foes.

entries.name: Special
entries: If hit and affected by the damage, they must make a Constitution saving throw, with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier, or be {@condition stunned} until the end of their next turn.

item.name: Widowmaker
entries: This is one of the large, heavy throwing blades used by {@creature the Night|FFESLL}; able to silently kill at range, they leave great gaping wounds on their victims.

entries.name: Special
entries: On a critical hit this weapon deals an additional {@damage 2d4} piercing damage.

entries.name: Special
entries: If hit, the target must succeed a Constitution saving throw, with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier, or take an additional {@damage 3d4} fire damage.

entries.name: Special
entries: If hit, the target must succeed a Constitution saving throw, with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier, or take an additional {@damage 3d4} fire damage.

entries.name: Special
entries: If hit, any creature within 5ft. of the target must succeed a Dexterity saving throw, with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier, or take an additional {@damage 3d4} fire damage.

entries.name: Special
entries: Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw, with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier. A creature takes {@damage 2d6} plus your dexterity modifier in fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

entries.name: Special
entries: Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw, with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier. A creature takes {@damage 2d6} plus your dexterity modifier in fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

entries.name: Special
entries: Each creature in a 30-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw, with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier. A creature takes {@damage 2d8} plus your dexterity modifier in fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

entries.name: Special
entries: Choose a point within range. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Constitution saving throw, with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier. A creature takes {@damage 2d8} thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature made of inorganic material such as stone, crystal, or metal has disadvantage on this saving throw. A nonmagical object that isn't being worn or carried also takes the damage if it's in the effect's area.

entries.name: Special
entries: On a hit this weapon deals an additional {@damage 1d12} radiant damage.

entries.name: Special
entries: On a hit this weapon deals an additional {@damage 1d12} radiant damage.

entries.name: Special
entries: On a hit the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of their next turn.

entries.name: Special
entries: If hit, the target must succeed a Constitution saving throw, with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier, or take an additional {@damage 2d6} fire damage at the start of their next turn.

entries.name: Special
entries: If an attack with this weapon is a critical hit it deals an additional {@damage 1d8} piercing damage.

entries.name: Special
entries: If an attack with this weapon is a critical hit it deals an additional {@damage 1d8} piercing damage.

entries.name: Special
entries: If an attack with this weapon is a critical hit it deals an additional {@damage 1d8} piercing damage.

entries.name: Special
entries: This weapon fires a beam of energy in a line 30 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw, with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier. A creature takes {@damage 2d8} radiant damage for each creature in the line on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. If any of the damage dice roll maximum damage you may roll one additional damage die.

item.name: Metal Shot Magazine
entries: A magazine containing 12 metal shots or "bolts".

item.name: Sunfire Canister
entries: A canister containing enough ammunition for 4 shots.

item.name: Fire-fuel Tank
entries: A container with enough fuel for 2 shots.

item.name: Custodian Armour
entries: This set of armour is designed for a large humanoid creature to wear, if a medium sized creature desires to wear this set of armour they must get the armour resized by someone proficient in {@item Smith's Tools|PHB} and {@item Tinker's Tools|PHB} at a cost of 12,500gp.

item.name: The Armour Elavagar
entries: Enemies whom attempt to attack the wearer up close suffer a -2 penalty to their melee attack rolls and the wearer's AC increases by +1 when he's targeted by an attack that deals fire damage. Additionally all hostile creatures within 5 feet of the wearer at the end of his turn suffer {@damage 1d8} cold damage.

This set of armour is designed for a large humanoid creature to wear, if a medium sized creature desires to wear this set of armour they must get the armour resized by someone proficient in {@item Smith's Tools|PHB} and {@item Tinker's Tools|PHB} at a cost of 12,500gp.

item.name: The Armour of Mars
entries: This set of armour is designed for a large humanoid creature to wear, if a medium sized creature desires to wear this set of armour they must get the armour resized by someone proficient in {@item Smith's Tools|PHB} and {@item Tinker's Tools|PHB} at a cost of 12,500gp.

item.name: The Armour of Reason
entries: A polished and decorated set of plate armour that grants the wearer advantage on the first saving throw he has to make each round.

This set of armour is designed for a large humanoid creature to wear, if a medium sized creature desires to wear this set of armour they must get the armour resized by someone proficient in {@item Smith's Tools|PHB} and {@item Tinker's Tools|PHB} at a cost of 12,500gp.

item.name: The Armour of The Word
entries: This armour grants advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects and imposes disadvantage on spell attack rolls made against wearer.

This set of armour is designed for a large humanoid creature to wear, if a medium sized creature desires to wear this set of armour they must get the armour resized by someone proficient in {@item Smith's Tools|PHB} and {@item Tinker's Tools|PHB} at a cost of 12,500gp.

item.name: The Auric Armour
entries: The wearer ignores damage from damage dice that rolled a 1 or a 2.

This set of armour is designed for a large humanoid creature to wear, if a medium sized creature desires to wear this set of armour they must get the armour resized by someone proficient in {@item Smith's Tools|PHB} and {@item Tinker's Tools|PHB} at a cost of 12,500gp.

item.name: The Barbaran Plate
entries: This set of armour is designed for a large humanoid creature to wear, if a medium sized creature desires to wear this set of armour they must get the armour resized by someone proficient in {@item Smith's Tools|PHB} and {@item Tinker's Tools|PHB} at a cost of 12,500gp.

item.name: The Leonine Panoply
entries: Once per turn, whilst wearing this armour, the wearer may re-roll a failed saving throw.

This set of armour is designed for a large humanoid creature to wear, if a medium sized creature desires to wear this set of armour they must get the armour resized by someone proficient in {@item Smith's Tools|PHB} and {@item Tinker's Tools|PHB} at a cost of 12,500gp.

item.name: The Draken Scale
entries: An relic suit of armour with a large drake skull mounted on one pauldron. The wearer reduces damage taken from fire and radiant damage by half. This occurs before any applicable resistances are applied.

Additionally this armour incorporates a unique {@item heavy flamethrower} on one of the gauntlets which may be used as an action and has the recharge property instead of the ammunition property. When used each creature in a 30-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw, with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier. A creature takes {@damage 4d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

This set of armour is designed for a large humanoid creature to wear, if a medium sized creature desires to wear this set of armour they must get the armour resized by someone proficient in {@item Smith's Tools|PHB} and {@item Tinker's Tools|PHB} at a cost of 12,500gp.

item.name: The Gilded Panoply
entries: Any creature that rolls a natural 1 when attacking the wearer of this armour with a melee attack must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of their next turn.

This set of armour is designed for a large humanoid creature to wear, if a medium sized creature desires to wear this set of armour they must get the armour resized by someone proficient in {@item Smith's Tools|PHB} and {@item Tinker's Tools|PHB} at a cost of 12,500gp.

item.name: The Horned Raiment
entries: When the wearer is hit by a critical hit, roll a d20. On a 15 or higher the extra damage from the critical hit is negated.

This set of armour is designed for a large humanoid creature to wear, if a medium sized creature desires to wear this set of armour they must get the armour resized by someone proficient in {@item Smith's Tools|PHB} and {@item Tinker's Tools|PHB} at a cost of 12,500gp.

item.name: The Logos
entries: A unique and finely crafted suit of armour, the logos grants the wearer immunity to being {@condition blinded} or {@condition stunned} and has a pair of wrist cannons integrated into it. The wrist cannons have a range of 60/180ft., use {@item metal shot magazine|FFESLL} for ammunition, have a capacity of 12 and deal {@damage 3d6} force damage on a hit; on a critical hit the target takes an additional {@damage 1d12} force damage.
The Logos has gauntlets that deal {@damage 2d4} bludgeoning damage when used for a melee attack.

Additionally the logos may let the wearer make his voice boom up to three times as loud and he may communicate with another creature within 30 feet of him as if the wearer was stood next to that creature.

This set of armour is designed for a large humanoid creature to wear, if a medium sized creature desires to wear this set of armour they must get the armour resized by someone proficient in {@item Smith's Tools|PHB} and {@item Tinker's Tools|PHB} at a cost of 12,500gp.

item.name: The Medusan Carapace
entries: An ornate and complex suit of armour incorporating various intricate contraptions on mechanical arms. The wearer may reduce the damage taken from ranged attacks by an amount equal to {@damage 3d6} and is considered to have thieves' tools and tinker's tools whilst wearing this armour.

Additionally this armour has two mechanical arms extending from the back of it, one holding a {@item flamethrower|FFESLL} and the other holding a {@item gravity cannon|FFESLL}. As an action one of these weapons may be used.

When using the {@item flamethrower|FFESLL} each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw, with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier. A creature takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

When using the {@item gravity cannon|FFESLL} you choose a point within 30 feet. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Constitution saving throw, with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier. A creature takes {@damage 2d8} thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature made of inorganic material such as stone, crystal, or metal has disadvantage on this saving throw. A nonmagical object that isn't being worn or carried also takes the damage if it's in the effect's area.

This set of armour is designed for a large humanoid creature to wear, if a medium sized creature desires to wear this set of armour they must get the armour resized by someone proficient in {@item Smith's Tools|PHB} and {@item Tinker's Tools|PHB} at a cost of 12,500gp.

item.name: The Nightmare Mantle
entries: Bedecked in grisly trophies of judgement and flayed skins this suit of armour is a horror to behold. Each creature that can see the wearer must succeed a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end of it's next turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to The Nightmare Mantle for the next 24 hours.

This set of armour is designed for a large humanoid creature to wear, if a medium sized creature desires to wear this set of armour they must get the armour resized by someone proficient in {@item Smith's Tools|PHB} and {@item Tinker's Tools|PHB} at a cost of 12,500gp.

item.name: The Pythian Scales
entries: Questa armatura garantisce l'immunità ai danni da acido e da veleno.

This set of armour is designed for a large humanoid creature to wear, if a medium sized creature desires to wear this set of armour they must get the armour resized by someone proficient in {@item Smith's Tools|PHB} and {@item Tinker's Tools|PHB} at a cost of 12,500gp.

item.name: The Regalia Resplendent
entries: This set of armour is designed for a large humanoid creature to wear, if a medium sized creature desires to wear this set of armour they must get the armour resized by someone proficient in {@item Smith's Tools|PHB} and {@item Tinker's Tools|PHB} at a cost of 12,500gp.

item.name: The Sable Armour
entries: Integrated into The Sable Armour are a pair of mighty wings made of adamantine metal that grant the wearer a flying speed of 120ft., and the wearer may make a melee attack with them as a bonus action. On a hit they deal {@damage 1d8} slashing damage, which is considered adamantine for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity.

This set of armour is designed for a large humanoid creature to wear, if a medium sized creature desires to wear this set of armour they must get the armour resized by someone proficient in {@item Smith's Tools|PHB} and {@item Tinker's Tools|PHB} at a cost of 12,500gp.

item.name: The Serpent's Scales
entries: When the wearer of this armour is targeted by a magical attack, spell or effect roll a {@dice d20}. On a roll of 11 or higher the damage and effects of the triggering magical attack, spell or effect are negated.
Additionally the wearer has advantage on saving throws against any effect that would lower their ability scores.

This set of armour is designed for a large humanoid creature to wear, if a medium sized creature desires to wear this set of armour they must get the armour resized by someone proficient in {@item Smith's Tools|PHB} and {@item Tinker's Tools|PHB} at a cost of 12,500gp.

item.name: The Wildfire Panoply
entries: The wearer's movement is unaffected by difficult terrain, and spells and other magical effects can't reduce their movement speed.

This set of armour is designed for a large humanoid creature to wear, if a medium sized creature desires to wear this set of armour they must get the armour resized by someone proficient in {@item Smith's Tools|PHB} and {@item Tinker's Tools|PHB} at a cost of 12,500gp.

item.name: Praesidium Shield
entries: A tall shield the size of a person that is made from strong metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

entries.name: Special
entries: Whilst wielding this shield, if you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you can use your reaction to take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, interposing your shield between yourself and the source of the effect.
Additionally if you move no more than half your movement speed on your turn, you count as being in half cover against ranged attacks whilst wielding this shield.
If the wearer has a Strength score lower than 15, their speed is reduced by 10 feet.

item.name: Tower Shield
entries: A tall shield almost the size of a person that is made from strong wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

entries.name: Special
entries: Whilst wielding this shield, if you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you can use your reaction to take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, interposing your shield between yourself and the source of the effect.
Additionally if you move no more than half your movement speed on your turn, you count as being in half cover against ranged attacks whilst wielding this shield.
If the wearer has a Strength score lower than 15, their speed is reduced by 10 feet.

entries.name: Broken
entries: A broken firearm cannot be fired until it is repaired. To repair a broken firearm, you may use an action to attempt a tinker's tools ability check with a DC equal to 10 plus the weapon's base misfire score. On a success, the weapon is no longer considered broken.

entries.name: Capacity
entries: A firearm's capacity is the number of shots it can hold at one time. When a firearm has been fired a number of times equal to its capacity, it must be reloaded before firing again.

entries.name: Misfire
entries: If your natural roll for a ranged attack falls at or below the misfire score of the firearm you are using, you suffer a misfire. Your attack misses, any ammo you used in the attack is expended, and your firearm becomes broken. You must repair a broken firearm before using it.
If you don't need to make a ranged attack roll when firing a weapon with a misfire score, roll a d20 to determine if it misfires.

entries.name: Overheat
entries: If this weapon misfires it does so violently, injuring whomever is using it. A creature holding this weapon when it misfires takes the weapon's damage for the attack it misfired on.

entries.name: Reload
entries: Reloading a gun replaces your next attack you would make with the firearm, refilling the ammunition in the gun up to its capacity. If you prefer, you may instead use an action to reload your firearm.

entries.name: Masterwork
entries: You may re-roll damage die of a 1 with this weapon and must use the new roll, even if it is a 1.

entries.name: Magic
entries: Attacks made with this weapon count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

entries.name: Oversized
entries: This weapon is designed for a large creature, a medium creature has disadvantage on their attack rolls unless they have a Strength score of 15 or greater. Small or smaller creatures are unable to use this weapon.

entries.name: Recharge
entries: After firing this weapon requires time to recharge, this replaces the next attack you would make with the weapon. The weapon is considered recharged at the start of your turn.
